clinical_study.official_title: Implant-supported Mandibular Overdentures in Very Old Adults - a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate denture satisfaction following the conversion of existing mandibular complete dentures to implant-overdentures (IOD) in very old edentulous patients who depend on help for activities of daily living (ADL) and evaluate secondary endpoints such as functional, structural, nutritional, cognitive and patient-centered outcome measures.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Denture satisfaction
primary_outcome.description: VAS-scale score to evaluate the subjective satisfaction with the denture

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in cognitive function
secondary_outcome.description: Mini-Mental State Examination, to evaluate cognitive function (Folstein et al. 1975) Trail-making test A and B Verbal fluency test
IADL Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale (Lawton and Brody, 1969) MIF Measure of functional independence

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Blood markers
secondary_outcome.description: Albumin, Folic acid, Vitamin B12 (VitB12), Hemoglobin (Hb), C-reactive protein (CRP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Insertion in implant survival
Change from Insertion in Pocket depth
secondary_outcome.description: mesial and distal peri-implant probing depth

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Insertion in Plaque index
secondary_outcome.description: Plaque index on implants (Silness & Loe 1963) Denture plaque index

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Insertion in peri-implant bone loss
secondary_outcome.description: mesial and distal peri-implant bone loss, as evaluated on intraoral radiographs or OPTs

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Chewing efficiency
secondary_outcome.description: two color mixing test with bi-colored chewing gum (Schimmel et al 2007)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Maximum bite force
secondary_outcome.description: unilateral maximal bite force measured with force gauge

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Stimulated Saliva Flow Rate
secondary_outcome.description: whole saliva collected after chewing wax for 2 minutes on one side

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from Baseline in Masseter Muscle Thickness
secondary_outcome.description: ultrasound measurements of the masseter muscle thickness in contracted and relaxed state

arm_group.description: insertion of 2 interforaminal mandibular implants and conversion of the lower complete denture to an implant-overdenture
conventional reline of mandibular complete denture

intervention.description: Participants received two Straumann Standard Implants® in the interforaminal region using the recommended surgical protocol. The implants were loaded using Locator® attachments after six to eight weeks healing time by transforming the existing lower denture to an IOD.
intervention.other_name: Straumann Standard Implants® (SLA surface, 8mm length, RN, 4.1mm diameter)
Locator® attachments (Zest Anchors: Escondido, CA, USA)

intervention.description: conventional reline of the existing mandibular complete denture

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 75 years or older
- living institutionalized or receiving help for the ADL
- edentulous
- wearing complete dentures
- the lower denture had to cause discomfort to the degree that the patients were seeking treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe clinical depression
- dementia
- poorly controlled diabetes
- immunosuppression
- treatment with bisphosphonates
- condition precluding the surgical intervention for implant placement
